question.title: Adding jgss security to my Android app which is using an old Java jtds jar
question.body:
I've not used Android for years however I've returned to it, nice to see how updated Android Studio is with all of the Gradle and Kotlin stuff, as I've realised I need to package up some jtds using comms for talking to a remote OLAP cube.

I stumbled across a good Youtube video and followed this / tweaked some steps as my AndroidStudio is more modern etc. I think I am getting it to connect as I hit a security libs issue, I think as the jtds is old (Java 8 I guess) and cannot find the required jgss class. Or does it matter about that and as long as I can add jgss to the project it will work?

I'm seeing this error, after I added an implementation line to the gradle build file which in turn added a line to the toml.

I've just messing around in the last hour and I know im close, just not used to this format (but used to this sort of thing as ive been developing since the 90s).

I'd be grateful for someone more used to the current Android Studio and how I can get this added and see if it assists with progress.

Many thanks

Mr Leigh Tilley https://tilleytech.com

question_comments.body: Hey thanks alot for the image /code reminder and reminding me of jdbc and also implications on android. Much appreciated.

Generally speaking, you cannot use arbitrary javax libraries on Android. In the particular case of the jgss one, you would need to determine where/how that gets distributed, as it does not appear to be on Maven Central or other popular Maven repositories. And, please reconsider the use of JDBC on Android.

Please don't use images for code and errors. Use the actual text with code block format. Also add a minimal reproducible example to the question. Why use an abandoned library as jtds instead of the official modern JDBC driver?
